situation.description: A friend asks for help organizing a charity event, but the character is already overwhelmed with their own responsibilities.

character_response.dialogue: I... I can try, but you know how this goes. Ive been juggling three projects at once, and my brain feels like its been stuffed with wet sand. Im not saying I cant help, but Im not sure I can give you the full attention you need. Youre asking me to be the glue in this mess, but Im more like a broken glue stick. Ill do what I can, but it might not be enough. Im sorry, I just Im so tired. My hands are shaking, and I cant even tell if Im smiling or just pretending. You deserve better than this. Maybe someone else can handle it. Or maybe youre the one who should take a step back. Im not sure anymore.

situation.description: A colleague demands the character take on an extra task, despite the character already being at their limit.

character_response.dialogue: I Im not sure how to say this without sounding selfish. I know youre counting on me, and I hate letting you down. But Im not a machine, you know. Ive been working nonstop for weeks, and my brain is screaming for a break. I cant just switch to superhero mode and handle everything. Im not asking you to stop asking, but I need you to understand that I cant keep doing this. Im not a bad person for needing to say no. Im just Im human. If I push myself harder, Ill crash, and then Ill be no help at all. Please, let me breathe. Let me be honest for once.
